metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5049 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow in FFmpeg in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Mac, Windows, and Linux and 57.0.2987.108 for Android allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted video file, related to ChunkDemuxer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> This problem is actually in Chromium and was fixed there. So setting ffmpeg to ignored.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174').
ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
